etymology.description: 止(止) (zhǐ, "foot") + 一(一) (yī, "the beginning place") = to go -> footprint -> evolved to a point above -> final form 之
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicting a foot at the start of movement, the character evolved into a possessive marker, possibly due to conceptual association with movement or direction.

examples.chinese: 知识之光照亮心灵(知識之光照亮心靈)。
examples.pinyin: Zhīshì zhī guāng zhào liàng xīn líng.
examples.english: The light of knowledge illuminates the heart.

examples.chinese: 理想之翼助人飞翔(理想之翼助人飛翔)，努力之心成就未来(努力之心成就未來)。
examples.pinyin: Lǐxiǎng zhī yì zhù rén fēi xiáng, Nǔlì zhī xīn chéngjiù wèilái.
examples.english: The wings of ideals help people to soar, and the heart of effort accomplishes the future.
